com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.linearrealarithmetic

public class LinearRealArithmeticTheory
extends AbstractNumericTheory
    A Theory for linear real arithmetic literals.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinearRealArithmeticTheory

        public LinearRealArithmeticTheory(boolean atomFunctorsAreUniqueToThisTheory,
                                  boolean propagateAllLiteralsWhenVariableIsBound)
        Creates an linear real arithmetic theory. It takes an argument indicating whether all equalities and disequalities are literals in this theory; this may not be the case if a CompoundTheory mixing multiple theories involving equalities is being used.

        Testing information is initialized to variables X, Y, Z in interval [0;4].

        Parameters:
        atomFunctorsAreUniqueToThisTheory - whether all equalities and disequalities can be safely assumed to belong to this theory (if you know all such expressions are literals in this theory, invoke this constructor with a true argument).
        propagateAllLiteralsWhenVariableIsBound - whether literals on a variable bound to a term should be immediately replaced by a literal on that term instead.

      • getNativeTypes

        public java.util.Collection<Type> getNativeTypes()
        This is overridden to add an instance of RealExpressoType to testing types as well. This is needed because arithmetic expressions such as J + 5 are determined to be of type name "Real" by GrinderUtil.getTypeExpressionOfExpression(Expression expression, Registry registry), so a type with this name is needed by the default implementation of AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms.isAtom(Expression, Context) if the flag for analyzing the types of arguments to equalities is true.
        Specified by:
        getNativeTypes in interface Theory
        Overrides:
        getNativeTypes in class AbstractTheory
        Returns:
